content.description: Climb up to a roof, go right around the roof and follow the thin crack in the face to its end then climb the arete to the top.
content.protection: Bolted anchors. Standard rack.

content.description:
P1 Climb the thin face on the left face of the large open book. Not always straight forward. 

  P2 Climb up a black-streak face over an overhang and to the anchors.
content.protection: Draws

content.description: 2 pitch route that takes the proudest line up the buttress.  Crimpy face crux moves. Sorry, but I can't comment on P2.
content.protection: You definitely want a 5 inch cam for the wide horizontal 25 ft up.  You may be able to fit a 00 TCU a foot above this if you need additional security.  A bolt (long reach) protects the next (crux) section.
content.location: Right of the wet, black gully that marks the left side of the buttress.  Shares an anchor with Wake & Bake.

content.description: Climb the blocky corner to the base of an obvious hand crack.  Follow the crack through a small overhang (crux).  Continue up the now finger sized crack to a ledge and then up a short corner to a fixed anchor.
content.protection: Standard Rack
content.location: The left end of the main wall at a large right facing, blocky corner.

content.description: So short, but so good!  TR it off the cedar (scramble loose ledges on the left) or lead it, it's a great little problem.
content.protection: Small gear down low, up to hand size higher up.
content.location: Maybe 100 yd left of Snake Charmer,  As you walk left along the base of the Main Wall, look for the short, sheer vertical face.  It's split by this zig zag crack coming down to an orange overhang maybe 8 feet up.

content.description: Sweet but short hand crack.  FA unknown, I found an old cam - rusted to death - and bail biner at the top of the crack.  As with all new Shelving routes, watch for loose rock.
content.protection: 1 to 3 inch gear will sew this thing up.  Bolts/chains at the top.
content.location: Far left end of the Main Wall, maybe 150 feet from the left end.  You can see the right end of the Carhartt Wall from here, at least when the leaves are off the trees.  The anchor at the top also sets up the steep right-facing corner to the right.  This can be stemmed at 5.5, or you can climb just the (overhanging) left wall of the corner at (tentative) 5.11a.  These lines have been cleaned but not yet led.

content.description: Climb up sandy textured rock on good holds to the first bolt and the base of a steep openbook.  Technical stemming and good crimps lead up this until it is possible to pull over a bulge into a right facing corner (crux in my opinion).  Continue up corner and orange face above, passing another bolt to the anchors.
content.protection: Mostly bolted.  A small rack (up to BD #1).  The start is gear protected, as is the corner after the crux section (small cam).  Bolt Anchors.
content.location: There is a natural low point between the Wake and Bake Area and The Gong Show area of the main wall.  Rusty Lumberjack begins on top of a boulder at the bottom of this low section.  Directly left of the large roof of Claim Jumper.

content.description: Up the corner then follow the bolt line through sustained moves all the way to the anchors.
content.protection: Draws. Bolted anchors.
content.location: At a right facing corner with staked blocks.

content.description: A Gunkish route.  Climb a steepening left facing corner with a vertical crack up to a large roof.  Undercling traverse right with decent feet until its possible to pull the roof on its right side to a stance. Move up and then traverse back left above the roof using a wide horizontal (big cam).  Continue left to a stance below a flake.  Climb the flake up the steep face(crux) and work back right to fixed anchors.
content.protection: Standard Rack    Large Cam BD #4 or #5 helpful but I wouldn't say crucial
content.location: The far left end of the Main Wall.  The 6' roof caps a left facing corner twenty feet off the deck.

content.description: One of the worst routes at Shelving. Weird gear, u almost dont need more than a piece or two.  Up to a cedar tree and an easy traverse ledge which brings you to the anchors of Wake and Bake.  Its  worthwhile if leading the other climbs to those anchors is not in the parties best interest.
content.protection:
A couple cams mayne 1,2,3 BD and some runners 

  Traverse left to fixed anchors
content.location: The block vegetated corner left of Wake and Bake

content.description: A quality sport route to the left of the Gong Show. Climb up the first bolt of the Gong Show, then step left at the jug on the arete. Follow bolts passing the obvious overhang on it's right end, with sidepulls and good holds and a technical crux past the overhang
content.protection: Bolts

content.description: An interesting endeavor.  Climb the initial steep wall past a couple bolts to a stance on a horizontal cedar tree!  Continue up the somewhat dirty face (new climb). Plug in gear where you can.  I think a .5 and 1" piece through this section.  Trend left into a steep corner with a thin crack system.  Work up the corner (small cams/nuts) until its possible to move up and right to a bolted anchor.  I found this climb to be pretty sustained but would have to say that the moves in the corner are the crux.  An exciting lead.
content.protection: Draws.  Nuts.  Gear to 1".  Make sure to have some small stuff for the corner at the top.
content.location: A few feet left of Snake Charmer.  Look for some bolts up the face and a horizontal cedar tree about 25' up.

content.description:
Pitc 1 - Begin up grey rock and traverse left over or through a deep a slot.  From here work up a crack with grear placement. Once at the top make an exposed move around the front of the flake heading right.  Then work up a headwall with a few crimpy moves to fixed anchors. 10a 

  Pitch 2 - I have yet to climb so i dont want to descibe it yet. I will update once I have. Others feel free to comment if have.
content.protection: A few bolts and and a standard single rack of cams and wires

content.description:
This is a sweet pitch with powerful moves and delicate feet up a steep section of cliff. 

  Climb up the crack/flake and plug a #2 C4 near the top to protect the run-out to the first bolt (not mandatory, but nice. A really looong stick clip could probably also work). Work up over some slight bulges to a jug below a right facing corner. A long draw on this bolt helps. Struggle into the corner then make the reach up and left around the block and climb up toward the big bulge above. A couple bouldery moves (crux) will leave you on easy ground just below the chains.
content.protection: 8 bolts and a 2" cam
content.location: Slightly down the hill to climbers right of the big boulder. Starts at the obvious crack/flake.

content.description:
Easy climbing up to first bolt below an overhang with a 5 inch slot.  Pull up into an open book on crimps and a small right facing corner(crux).  Continue past another bolt and through easier terrain past a flake and some less than ideal rock.  Join Monty Python and finish through the bolted headwall. 

  Be aware of loose rock on this route.
content.protection: 4 draws.  Gear to .75. Bolt anchor.
content.location: A few feet right of Monty Python.  Easily identified by looking for a 5 inch slot beneath an overhang 20 feet up.

content.description: Doesn't look nearly as cool as it climbs. Up the corner and work up the right rising slot(gear).  Trend left up to a ledge on nice holds.  Move up and right (crux) past a couple bolts.  Follow and easier corner towards a white birch and look for bolted anchor.
content.protection: 2bolts. Gear to 2".  I like a yellow and  blue tcu mid route to protect the moves up to the first bolt.
content.location: Same as Snake Charmer.  Climb the initial corner to a slot that rises right of the Snake Charmer crack.  Stay to the right of the large triangular prow of rock 60' up.

content.description: Climb the left facing flake.  Gear can be placed to protect moves to first bolt.  Be careful. The holds are good but a fall before the bolt would not be.  Work up the small corner system past bolts to a ledge.  Continue up on gear to a thin crack.  Follow this through a steep spot and onto a fixed anchor on a big cedar tree.  A full value 5.8!  Steep, sustained and under rated.  Good times.
content.protection: Draws.  Standard rack. Small gear for crux up high.
content.location: Look for a left facing flake with a bolt.

content.description: Sustained face climbing with two distinct balance-y cruxes, one standing up after the first bolt and one standing up after the (relatively easy) roof.Well-bolted throughout. You could throw a micro cam in just below the roof (with a long runner) but reaching the bolt after the roof isn't nearly as hard as standing up after the roof.
content.protection: 13 bolts, bolted chain anchor
content.location: Start toward the right of the blocky overgrown at the base of the main wall just uphill from the large boulder. Follow a line of bolts up the dark face of rock pulling the left side of a small roof halfway up.g

content.description: Climb a thin face past a bolt to a 2' roof. Pull the roof with what ever beta you can find. Follow a huge flake BD #.75-3 size cam up to more thin face above.
content.protection: A BD .75 and 3 and cams.

content.description: This is not a sport route! Great climb from bottom to top.  Work up the left rising crack to a ledge.  Continue through a few bolts to a good stance below another crack.  Follow this up and right as it narrows to tips.  Small cams/nuts here.  Continue up and right to fixed anchors shared with Rock Lobster.
content.protection: Standard Rack and Draws
content.location: 20'right of Gong Show at a left rising crack.

content.description: up a left facing corner about 12 off the ground to small roof with a fix nut. step right and go up to large roof pull roof. then up to an overhang go over the overhang(crux). left around a bulge back right and up. finish in a right facing corner with a big crack in it to a ledge.
content.protection: some small gear then the rest is quickdraws with bolt anchors at the top
content.location: in the middle of the main wall after going downhill.   just right of rusty lumberjack.

content.description: As you are walking on the main trail from the parking lot, you will start to see the a big wall off to you right. You will be excited but resist the temptation to hike right to it. Keep hiking on your current trail for a bit. You will see a spine of rock off and to the left that is perpendicular to your current trail. Maybe 5 ft tall and 40ft long. The trail splits, go right. Continue up hill to the top of the trail. At the top (meaning that it goes down hill after that), in front of the large flat boulder(s), look right, you will see cairns and a u shaped groove trail through the talus field. At the top you will be walking on a thin trail through a carpet of vines. Once you get to the wall, turn left. The first climb with bolts is "wake and bake".
